title: Michael Yo
text:
Michael Yo Simmons is an American actor, stand-up comedian, and television host who co-hosted "<a href="The%20Insider%20%28TV%20series%29">The Insider</a>" on <a href="CBS">CBS</a>, and currently hosts "Yo Show" on <a href="Yahoo%21%20TV">Yahoo! TV</a>. Yo also appears regularly on the comedy panel of "<a href="Chelsea%20Lately">Chelsea Lately</a>", as a guest host for "<a href="The%20Talk%20%28TV%20series%29">The Talk</a>" on CBS, and as <a href="pop%20culture">pop culture</a> commentator on "<a href="Showbiz%20Tonight">Showbiz Tonight</a>". Michael played football for the University of Arkansas, but his football career was cut short due to multiple concussions.
His stand up special debut “Blasian” was released November 27, 2018. <a href="https%3A//m.imdb.com/title/tt8299862/"></a>
His film credits include "<a href="Losing%20Control">Losing Control</a>", "<a href="The%20Cookout%202">The Cookout 2</a>", and <a href="Sofia%20Coppola">Sofia Coppola</a>’s "<a href="Bling%20Ring">Bling Ring</a>".
Career.
Yo previously worked as a correspondent for "<a href="E%21%20News">E! News</a>", "The Daily 10", and "Extra". He coached Kourtney and <a href="Khlo%C3%A9%20Kardashian">Khloé Kardashian</a> as radio DJs for their show "<a href="Kourtney%20%26amp%3B%20Khlo%C3%A9%20Take%20Miami">Kourtney & Khloé Take Miami</a>" on E!.
In 2001, he appeared in a season one episode of "<a href="Fear%20Factor">Fear Factor</a>" in which contestants had to free fall from a hotel window hundreds of feet high, eat sheep's eyes and hang upside down in a water tank.
He started a podcast together with comedian <a href="Jo%20Koy">Jo Koy</a> on July 23, 2012 called "The Michael Yo and Jo Koy Show".
In November 2018, it was announced that his family comedy (inspired by his own life) was in development at Fox which he would star, co-write and produce.
On April 9, 2019, February 27, 2020, and May 12, 2020, Yo appeared on "<a href="The%20Joe%20Rogan%20Experience">The Joe Rogan Experience</a>".
He appeared on <a href="America%27s%20Got%20Talent%20%28season%2015%29">season 15</a> of "<a href="America%27s%20Got%20Talent">America's Got Talent</a>". Performing stand-up comedy, he received a yes from all 4 judges and advanced to the next round, but was eventually eliminated in the Quarter-Finals.
Personal life.
Yo says that being a <a href="multiracial">biracial</a> person who is half <a href="African%20Americans">black</a> and half Asian, he has "a uniquely relatable and American experience in life". Yo said "Comedy is not about one-liners and punchlines, it's about story telling and a real connection with the audience."
